column4: Theo nly thing I could find was for linux kernel that was 4 years old

Thought this ubuntu crap was supposed to be a good os
Because I dont haev a cd-r
I found my ubuntu cd's and figured I'd install it
it's not just Ubuntu, but many things in the Linux world are "less than ideal".  One could say they're just as broken as Windows, just in a different direction.  Not me, but one could.
so explain something for me tritium
See that page right there says my network card is auto detected and works fine
I've yet to see ANYWHERE on my setup where it even SEES my card let alone detects and installs anything for it
that's probably with the latest release
for example, I had a card that was listed as supported for the past three releases and it didn't work until the latest
